feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 5:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM MOVING NEAR MENTASTA LAKE... At 5 PM AKDT satellite observations and lightning detection networks indicated a strong thunderstorm moving east between Paxon and Mentasta Lake in the far northern Copper River Basin. This thunderstorm may impact Mentasta Lake and the Mentasta Pass area during the next one to two hours with frequent lightning, gusty

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Moderate to heavy rainfall will continue to fall over the Seward Peninsula and western Brooks Range, as the remnants of post- tropical typhoon Merbok track northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Expect three-day rainfall totals around 3 inches at Red Dog Mine, around 5 inches in the peaks of the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 1:14PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Prepare for Strong Wind, Snow and Cold above 7500` on Mt. Shasta This Weekend... The first significant change in the weather for the fall season is upon us. A cold upper low pressure system will move into the region Saturday, causing winds to increase with falling snow levels on Mount Shasta.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 17 at 9:59PM CDT until September 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL POTTAWATTAMIE COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 1000 PM CDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However small hail is still possible with this thunderstorm.
